in hand.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if something is in hand, it is being done or dealt with
in hand.translation[0].definitions[0].no: take somebody in hand (=begin to deal with someone’s problems etc)
in hand.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Plans are in hand to perform ‘Oz’ next semester.
Lisa seemed to have things in hand by the time he returned.
Our officers have to concentrate 100 per cent on the task in hand.
in hand.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if you work a week, a month etc in hand, you do not get paid until after you have worked two weeks, two months etc
in hand.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if you have time, money etc in hand, you have it available
in hand.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I usually have a few days’ leave in hand at the end of the year.
in hand.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if a team or player has a game in hand in a competition, they still have another game to play in which they could gain more points
